msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 2 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 37(?); Fol. 1: Qurʾānic Text: Q 46:33-47:2; Dimensions: 175 x 108mm; Fol. 2: Qurʾānic Text: Q 18:19; Dimensions: 162 x 10mm.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 23: "65 E. H. 37. Kur’an’dan parçalar. Parşömen. 108mm boy ve 175 mm eninde ve 10 mm boy ve 162 mm eninde birer yaprak. Bunlarda ʿAlī b. abī Ṭālib’e atfolunuyor ise de muahhar olduğu şüphesizdir. Bu yaprakların bir yüzü yazılı olup mavimsi muslin üzerine yapıştırılmıştır. I. Yaprağın birinin üzerinde Aḥḳāf (46) suresinin 33. /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable {mso-style-name:"Normale Tabelle"; mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0; mso-tstyle-colband-size:0; mso-style-noshow:yes; mso-style-priority:99; mso-style-parent:""; mso-padding-alt:0cm 5.4pt 0cm 5.4pt; mso-para-margin-top:0cm; mso-para-margin-right:0cm; mso-para-margin-bottom:8.0pt; mso-para-margin-left:0cm; line-height:107%; mso-pagination:widow-orphan; font-size:11.0pt; font-family:"Calibri",sans-serif; mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri; mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin; mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri; mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin; mso-bidi-font-family:Arial; mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi; mso-ansi-language:TR; mso-fareast-language:EN-US;} ayetinin (السموا)ت والأرض ولم يعي… kelimesinden Muḥammad (47) suresine geçerek 2. ayeti olan واصلح kelimesiyle bitiyor. II. Diğer yaprak Kahf (18) suresinin 19. ayetinin ortasında فليأتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ibaresini ihtiva etmektedir."

This can be translated as follows: "65 E. H. 37. Fragments of the Qurʾān. Parchment. A leaf measuring 108 mm height and 175 mm width, and another leaf measuring 10 mm height and 162 mm width. Although these are attributed to ʿAlī b. abī Ṭālib, their authenticity is doubtful. One side of these leaves is inscribed and glued onto bluish muslin. I. One of the leaves contains Q 46:33 (Sūra al-Aḥqāf) starting with the word (السموا)ت والأرض ولم يعي… and continuing through Q 47:2 (Sūra Muḥammad) until the word واصلح. II. The other leaf contains the middle part of Q 18:19 (Sūra al-Kahf), including the phrase فليأتكم برزق منه وليتلطف."
As both Karatay 65 and Karatay 96 seemingly describe shelfmark "E. H. 37", the correct attribution is currently not certain.
